extensionDescription.message: Integrate VPN into Firefox: Exclude Tabs, set Site locations and more!

back.description: Alt attribute text for back button

notificationContent.description: Tells the user which link they clicked.

titleServerList.description: The header of a Serverlist, prompting the user to select a location

titlePageSettings.description: The header for website specific settings i.e exclude a page from vpn

exludePageFor.message: Always turn off VPN protection for  $origin$
exludePageFor.description: Setting to exclude a website from vpn

resetPageSettings.description: Button Text to Reset all Site specific settings

vpnIsOn.message: VPN protection for Firefox is on
vpnIsOn.description: Header to signal that VPN connection is enabled

vpnIsOff.message: VPN protection for Firefox is off
vpnIsOff.description: Header to signal that VPN connection is disabled

extensionVpnIsOff.message: Protection for Firefox is off, even if your desktop VPN is on.
extensionVpnIsOff.description: Popup subtitle when the extension VPN is off, but the client VPN is on.

vpnOffStatus.description: Label indicating that the VPN is off.

vpnOnStatus.description: Label indicating that the VPN is on.

headlineWebsitePreferences.description: Headline for the Website Preferences page.

placeholderSearchWebsites.description: Placeholder text for the search input field to search websites.

tableHeadingWebsite.description: Table heading for the column listing websites.

tableHeadingVpnStatus.description: Table heading for the column indicating whether the VPN is on or off for a website.

tableHeadingLocation.description: Table heading for the column showing the location of the website.

headlineNoWebsitePreferences.message: You haven't set any website preferences yet
headlineNoWebsitePreferences.description: Headline shown when the user hasn't set any website preferences.

noWebsitePreferencesSubText.message: If you turn off VPN protection or set a custom location for any websites, you'll see them here.
noWebsitePreferencesSubText.description: Subtext shown when there are no website preferences set by the user.

altTextRemoveWebsiteButton.description: Alt text for the button that removes a website rule from the list of preferences.

altTextOpenSettingsPage.description: Alt text for the button that opens the Extensions Settings page

searchServer.description: Placeholder for the Input field Where users can search the Serverlist

bodySubscribeNow.message: No subscription found. Click the button below to subscribe to Mozilla VPN.
bodySubscribeNow.description: Body of an Error Message, shown if the user is trying to use the Extension without a Subscription.

btnSubscribeNow.description: Call to Action button for users to subscribe to Mozilla VPN

getHelp.description: Text of a link pointing to a relevant help page

headerSignedOut.message: Sign in to your Mozilla account

bodySignedOut.message: You’re currently signed out of your Mozilla account. To use the Mozilla VPN extension, please open the desktop app to sign in first.

headerInstallMsg.description: Header if a VPN installation was not found

bodyInstallMsg.message: In order to use the Mozilla VPN extension, you must first download Mozilla VPN on your desktop.

bodyInstallMsgFooter.message: Note that Mozilla VPN is a paid subscription service.

btnDownloadNow.description: This is a call to action button to download the VPN.

useDefaultLocationExplainer.message: This is always the same location as selected in your Mozilla VPN desktop app.
useDefaultLocationExplainer.description: Explanation of what 'Use default Mozilla VPN Location' means.

bodyUnsupportedOSMessage.message: Currently, the Mozilla VPN extension is only available on Windows devices.

footnoteUnsupportedOSMessage.message: We’re working to bring support to macOS and Linux soon!
